# Link Inventory Report

**Status:** Auto-generated report  
**Purpose:** Track all navigation links across the application and identify broken/temporary implementations  
**Last Manual Update:** 2025-01-XX

---

## Quick Start

To generate a live report:

1. Navigate to `/dev/link-health` in your development environment
2. Click "Refresh" to run the latest scan
3. Export reports as Markdown or Mermaid diagrams

Or run programmatically:

```typescript
import { generateLinkReport, exportReportMarkdown } from '@/utils/linkValidator';

const report = await generateLinkReport();
console.log(exportReportMarkdown(report));
```

---

## How to Read This Report

| Status | Icon | Meaning |
|--------|------|---------|
| **Working** | ‚úÖ | Link routes to an implemented page component |
| **Temporary** | ‚ö†Ô∏è | Route exists but uses temporary/placeholder implementation |
| **Broken** | üî¥ | Link references undefined route |
| **Orphaned** | üü° | Route defined but never linked to (unused) |

---

## Developer Guidelines

### Adding New Links

1. **Always use route constants** from `src/lib/routes.ts`
   ```tsx
   // ‚úÖ Good
   <Link to={routes.governance.inbox}>Inbox</Link>
   
   // ‚ùå Bad
   <Link to="/governance/inbox">Inbox</Link>
   ```

2. **Define route before linking**
   - Add route to `src/lib/routes.ts`
   - Add route to `LazyRouteManager.tsx`
   - Create component
   - Then create links

3. **Test navigation before PR**
   - Run link validation: Visit `/dev/link-health`
   - Verify no new broken links introduced
   - Add to test suite if critical path

---

## Automated Monitoring

This report will be auto-generated by:

- Pre-commit hooks (warnings for broken links)
- CI/CD pipeline (fail build on broken links)
- Daily scheduled job (track trends)

View live dashboard: `/dev/link-health`

---

**Generated by:** Link Validator Utility  
**Documentation:** See `src/utils/linkValidator.ts` for implementation details
